article.headline: Hereâs everything coming to Netflix in September 2020 â and whatâs leaving
article.body: Netflix Inc. is rolling out the big names with a slate of prestige releases in September 2020. Those include Ryan Murphyâs âOne Flew Over the Cuckooâs Nestâ prequel series âRatchedâ (Sept. 18)), starring Emmy-winner Sarah Paulson as the notorious nurse; the astronaut drama series âAwayâ (Sept. 4), starring Oscar-winner Hilary Swank; âEnola Holmesâ (Sept. 23), a movie starring Millie Bobby Brown (of âStranger Thingsâ) as Sherlockâs younger sister; and âIâm Thinking of Ending Thingsâ (Sept. 4), a psychologicalÂ horror film from Oscar-winning writer/director Charlie Kaufman. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Thatâs on top of a dump-truck load of new originals, including the Swedish detective prequel âYoung Wallanderâ (Sept. 3); the rom-com movie âLove, Guaranteedâ (Sept. 3) starring Rachael Leigh Cook and Damon Wayans Jr.; Season 2 of the British police-interrogation drama âCriminalâ (Sept. 16); the karaoke competition âSing On!â (Sept. 16) starring Tituss Burgess; the âJurassic Worldâ teen adventure spinoff âCamp Cretaceousâ (Sept. 18); and a plateful of food porn including âChefâs Table: BBQâ (Sept. 2), âTaco Chronicles Volume 2â (Sept. 15) and âAmerican Barbecue Showdownâ (Sept. 18). Netflix NFLX, +1.43% Â is also adding all three âBack to the Futureâ movies (all Sept. 1), all six seasons of âSister, Sisterâ (Sept 1) and the final season of âThe Good Placeâ (Sept. 26). Also see: Whatâs coming in September to: Hulu | Amazon Prime Video And itâll be your last chance to check out the Korean zombie classic âTrain to Busan,â the first three âJurassic Parkâ movies and âThe Social Network,â among others, which will all leave by the end of the month.
